title.narrative: Climate Mainstreaming Facility (CMF) supporting FCDO departments to strengthen climate mainstreaming and the integration of International Climate Finance (ICF) - Future Climate for Africa (FCFA) Accountable Grant

description.narrative: As part of the FCFA Accountable Grant funded by the UK Government's Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO), previously referred to as the Department for International Development (DfID) (IATI identifier GB-1-203835-107), the Climate Mainstreaming Facility (CMF) was initiated to offer support to FCDO (previously DfID) country offices, regional and central departments to strengthen climate mainstreaming and the integration of International Climate Finance (ICF) in their portfolios. The facility aims to improve the uptake of climate information and climate risk analysis and adaptation assessment, including for integration, and enhance compliance with the DfID Smart Guide on Climate and Environment. FCDO country offices and departments access support by submitting a Request for Service (RfS) to the FCDO Facility Executive Committee (FEC). Once the FEC has approved the RfS, the Facility Management Team (FMT), allocate an appropriate expert to respond to the request.

SouthSouthNorth, through the Coordination, Capacity Development and Knowledge Exchange (CCKE) unit, hosts FCFA’s Climate Mainstreaming Facility (CMF). Due to the qualitative nature of this activity, all reporting is done through the submission of quarterly reports, rather than using IATI's quantitative submissions. This activity is referred to under Output 2 in the reporting.

activity-date.narrative: The Future Climate for Africa (FCFA) Accountable Grant programme start date is March 2019.

The initial end date for the Future Climate for Africa (FCFA) Accountable Grant programme was 31 August 2020, however, the programme received a no-cost extension in June 2020 to allow the programme to continue until March 2021.

mailing-address.narrative: 55 Salt River Road, Salt River, Cape Town, South Africa

recipient-region.narrative: To date: Kenya, Democratic Republic of Congo, Mozambique, Cote d'Ivoire, Madagascar, Pakistan, Myanmar, India and Afghanistan.

transaction.ref: Fees and Expenses: Quarter 1 (March, April & May 2019)

description.narrative: Aggregated expenditure (fees and expenses) for project-related activities. Fees include SouthSouthNorth and the Roster of Experts consultant fees. Expenses include travel, external design services etc.

provider-org.narrative: SouthSouthNorth (SSN) hosts the facility and disburses funds to the CMF consultants.

title.narrative: Quarter 1 Report (March, April & May 2019) - FCFA Accountable Grant

description.narrative: Reporting is completed quarterly using the DfID template. Reporting is primarily qualitative and progress is measured against the FCFA Accountable Grant logframe. All IATI reporting is done through the submission of the quarterly report documents. In the quarterly report, all progress defined as Output 2 is relevant to this activity.

title.narrative: DFID Climate Mainstreaming Facility: Terms of Reference for Roster of Experts

description.narrative: FID country offices and departments access support by submitting a Request for Service (RfS) to the DFID Facility Executive Committee (FEC). Once the FEC has approved the RfS, the Facility Management Team (FMT), allocate an appropriate expert to respond to the request.
